results.title: Breaking out of The Doll's House
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and Joseph Losey
results.brief_description: This film is edited from the feature film “The Doll’s House” which is an adaptation of the play by Ibsen, written in 1879. Jane Fonda plays the role of the main character Nora. A series of events in Nora’s married life forces her to turn back on her family and search for her own identity. This film raises discussion on the issues of feminine identity and is recommended for Years 11-12.

results.title: Breaking bows & arrows = Breaking bows and arrows
results.creator_credit: Tiger Eye, Firelight Film, Ellenor Cox and Liz Thompson
results.brief_description: On the island of Bougainville in Papua New Guinea, thousands of people were killed in a war of secession that grew from a local uprising against the Australian copper company CRA. The Bougainville Revolutionary Army was pitted against Papua New Guinean military forces, funded and trained by the Australian government. When the ten-year-old civil war ended in 1998, the islanders had to deal with the legacy of conflict between neighbours and begin to confront the challenging emotional terrain of personal reconciliation. “Breaking bows and arrows” documents the islanders’ road to forgiveness and healing, a process governed by their own cultural tradition. Traditional ceremonies and rituals played a powerful role in the reconciliation process, bringing together both victims and perpetrators in an attempt to heal the deep emotional wounds and reverse the legacy of anger, pain, and revenge. A powerful documentary that demonstrates that the path to true reconciliation begins with forgiveness. Teachers notes are available at http://www.filmaust.com.au/programs.

results.title: Breaking barriers
results.creator_credit: John Sexton Productions, New South Wales. Anti-Discrimination Board and New South Wales Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A look at your rights under the New South Wales Anti-Discrimination Act, 1977 where “equal opportunity” should be given to all and no discrimination should exist on the grounds of race, sex or marital status.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Sexton Productions, New South Wales. Anti-Discrimination Board and New South Wales Film Corporation

results.title: Breakfast in Paris
results.brief_description: A high-powered female fashion executive meets a handsome, carefree photographer and their relationship starts with hot glares and cold shoulders. Things don’t get much better for him until the romance of Paris catches up with her. Filmed on location in Paris. Stars Barbara Parkins, Rod Mullinar and Jack Lenoir.

results.title: Breakfast at Tiffany's
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Martin Jurow, Richard Shepherd and Blake Edwards
results.brief_description: Audrey Hephurn stars as Holly Golightly in the film based on the short story by Truman Capote. Holly’s almost frosty sophistication is only a veneer. Hepburn convey’s Holly’s underlying fragility with poignance and sympathy. George Peppard, as Paul the writer, like Holly is searching to find a place amongst the “fleshpots” and “rats” of New York. As their love blossoms, Paul must come to terms with the fact that Holly is a girl on the run, not only from the past, but from herself. New York, Tiffany’s, Givenchy’s stunning wardrobe for Hepburn, the magical music of Henry Mancini and Johnny Mercer’s song “Moon River”, help make this film a cinema classic. Mickey Rooney as Holly’s slightly deranged Japanese landlord, delights in a hilarious comic cameo.

results.title: Breaker Morant [DVD]
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Matt Carroll and Bruce Beresford
results.brief_description: It is 1901, South Africa. The British war against the Boers has deteriorated into bitter guerilla warfare. A unit of the Bushveldt Carbineers, made up mainly of Australians, is ordered by the British High Command to fight the Boers on their terms and take no prisoners, orders that were to prove fatal for Harry Morant. Cast includes Edward Woodward, Bryan Brown, Jack Thompson, John Waters and Charles Tingwell.

results.title: Breakdown
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Ralph Strasser
results.brief_description: A man is stranded on a lonely country road. The events which take place on the second day drive him from boredom to panic, to desperation.

results.title: Breakdown
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Vladimir Valenta and Peter Thurley
results.brief_description: A fictional film about two people and a salamander. The car they are travelling in collapses unceremoniously on the road to Montreal. Finding a mechanic in the quiet countryside is never easy, but here the problem is compounded by linguistic misunderstandings. Eventually the car runs again, but one of the passengers refuses to run along.

results.title: Breakdown
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Robert Anderson and Tom Daly
results.brief_description: The story of a young woman’s schizophrenic breakdown, and of her recovery in a modern mental hospital. Inherent in the film is an appeal for greater public understanding of mental illness and for the removal of the stigma that still surrounds it. The film presents the case of a seemingly well-adjusted young woman, showing the disintegration of her personality and the psychiatric treatment that follows.
